title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Navigraph is currently looking for a Fullstack Developer to join our Sim dev team in central Stockholm. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to work in a developer team in a mid-size company, serving a large and passionate user base worldwide. 🌍✈️
 




  





 About Navigraph
 


 Navigraph is a SaaS company providing aviation fans and aspiring pilots with charts, navigation data, flight planning tools, and training material. Our users fly everything from Microsoft Flight Simulator to X-Plane. With our Electronic Flight Bag, virtual avionics, flight planning tools, performance calculators, and teaching material we’re the trusted co-pilot for any serious virtual aviator.
 





  
 





 We have a modern tech stack for our main apps based on React and React Native, and also specialized GIS data pipelines and highly performant simulator integrations based on Rust (compiled to WASM) — all with a strong focus on usability and modern design. Our mission? To make flight simulation as realistic and immersive as possible by making data, software, and tools like those available to the aviation industry accessible for flight simulation gaming.
 




  






 With our HQ in Stockholm and a global crew of c. 45 aviation-loving professionals, led by our founders Magnus Axholt (CEO) and Stephen O’Connell (CTO), our team thrives on creativity, experimentation and collaboration. Join us, and you’ll discover a vibrant community, a thriving business, and a workplace where innovation takes off every day.
 




  






 Check out our career site for more information on who we are ✨. 
 




  





 What You’ll Do!
 
* Develop and maintain avionics extensions and external integrations for flight simulators
* Develop and maintain APIs that provide our extensive navigation datasets to 3rd parties, as well as our own applications
* Work on highly experimental and research-focused projects to push the boundaries of flight simulator integrations
* Ensure that Navigraph remains top-of-mind for new and well-established simulator add-on developers through innovations in developer experience and first-class direct developer support
* Work with high-volume, real-time flight data streams, supporting detailed visualisation and analysis
* Work on one of the most advanced Electronic Flight bags in the industry
* Develop and maintain the frontends and backends of our products, both web and desktop-based
* Shape the infrastructure and CI/CD processes around our projects
* Work with our extensive cloud-native processing pipelines, optimizing and improving our workflows
* Ensure a seamless user experience across platforms



  





 What We’re Looking For!
 


 We need someone with experience across the full stack who loves solving challenges and writing clean, efficient code.
 




  





 Required Skills
 
* Proven record of building and maintaining robust software
* Proficiency in Rust, TypeScript, React, Node.js, and relational databases
* Experience with backend and frontend development
* Experience with Electron and/or Tauri
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and CI/CD workflows
* Strong problem-solving skills and an eye for detail
* Fluent in written and spoken English



 Bonus Skills
 
* Passion for flight simulation and aviation
* Experience with flight simulator avionics
* Previous experience with managing cloud infrastructure - preferably AWS
* Previous experience with DevOps
* Previous experience with reverse engineering undocumented software or SDKs
* Understanding of principles in navigation and geography



 What We Offer!
 
* **Flexible Work Options** 

 : On-site and hybrid.
* **A great benefits package** 

 : please check out our career site.
* **Growth Opportunities** 

 : We’ll support your professional development and give you the resources to excel.
* **Memorable experiences** 

 : The Navigraph team is a tight-knit group with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We enjoy spending time together, and it is not uncommon for our yearly trips to flight simulator conventions in Europe and the U.S. to be combined with team-building activities that leave lasting impressions!



 How to Join the Team?
 


 We’re reviewing applications quickly - so don’t leave us hanging too long! 🚀✈️ Apply now and help us take Navigraph - and flight simulation - to the next level!

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
 As
 **Talent Acquisition Partner** 
 you will focus on supporting our central tech-, product- and commercial teams depending on their current needs. In this role you will partner with the hiring managers, supporting them in their recruitments, advising them in all areas relating to talent acquisition and coaching them continuously on Voi's best practices.
   

  

 In Addition, You Will Collaborate Closely With The Rest Of The Talent Acquisition Team, And The Wider People & Culture Function, To Develop And Strengthen Our Talent Acquisition Practice Across The Organisation. This Will Include
   

  

* Collaborating closely with hiring managers and HR Business Partners to understand hiring needs and communicating trends
* Owning and driving the recruitment process from start to finish
* Sourcing directly and working proactively to build diversified candidature pipelines
* Managing the communication with candidates and ensuring a stellar candidate experience at all times
* Contributing to the development of a strong culture by setting an example as a member of the People & Culture team


**What You’ll Need To Embark**
 We are looking for an ambitious and solution oriented Talent Acquisition professional who is resilient and thrives in a fast-paced, international environment. In addition to being fluent in English we believe the right person has:
   

  

* Several years of experience working with end to end recruitment, preferable within technical, product and commercial roles
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
* Experience or knowledge with different search & sourcing techniques together with a skill of finding talents outside of the obvious places
* Good knowledge of recruitment platforms & systems such as LinkedIn and Teamtailor
* Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and have a direct impact on Voi’s expansion, growth and continued success
* Work together with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Field Technician
company_industry: Market Research and Business Consulting and Services
description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.
   

  

**About the role :**
 Responsible for the installation and maintenance of Nielsen metering hardware and software in panel
   

  

 households, maintaining ongoing panel cooperation, and ensuring panel quality and security
   

  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**
* Foster and maintain strong panel member cooperation through more than formal relationships according to company procedure.
* Provides clear, courteous and effective telephone and Face-to-Face support for panel members. Install, maintain, and de-install Nielsen metering hardware and software in panel member households
* according to procedure.
* Conduct panel household questionnaire updates as assigned (e.g. demographic, lifestyle, privacy agreements, etc.)
* Collect and report panel data according to policy and procedure.
* Execute standard operating procedures to ensure panel quality and security is maintained.
* Manage assigned assets in order to maintain panel households and quality (e.g. metering equipment, laptop, company vehicle, mobile phone, etc.).
* Liaise with quality control, panel management, and recruitment staff to maintain panel quality and
* performance.


**KEY REQUIREMENTS:**
* Strong verbal and outstanding interpersonal communication skills
* 2+ years experience in the area of f2F customer service. Ideally - ISP Installer, Cable provider reps, home appliance installation etc.
* Sales/technical support/customer service background
* Exceptional Customer service / relationship-building skills and results orientation
* Strong English + Swedish proficiency
* Proficient computer hardware and software knowledge and skills
* University / Technical certificate
* Ability to operate effectively with high energy and flexibility in a quality, fast-paced, and constantly
* evolving environment
* Willingness to spend defined proportion of time travelling (in the field)
* Ability to work remotely, individually, and in a team environment
* Result oriented with aptitude for continuous process improvements
* Business acumen
* Valid driving license with clean background


 Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @ nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.
   

  

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Sales Assistant
description:
**Company Description**
 Since its creation in Paris in 1998, Maje has been able to build its own style and drawn a subtle line between modernity and quirkiness, by focusing on key pieces and sharp details. The Maje spirit is a very feminine silhouette, at once sober, glamorous and bold. Affiliate of the SMCP Group, the brand is successfully pursuing its international development and has 627 points of sale and close to 1,700 talented employees in 44 countries.
   

  

 In 2022, Maje achieved a turnover of more than 467 million euros. In recent years, the house has been approaching the digital transition with great ambition and accelerating its engagement towards sustainability. Inclusion and diversity are also at the heart of our preoccupations because we are convinced that innovation and creativity are born from a diversity of opinions and profiles. Because we want to offer to our employees and candidates an inclusive environment in which everyone has a place, regardless of their origin, background, and preferences, ...
   

  

 It's your turn to enrich our history! Dare to be adventurous and to take up a new challenge, come and express your talents within the Maje Family!
   

  

**Job Description**
**What we are offering:**
 A permanent
 **Sales Assistant** 
 position,
 **part time** 
 in our store in NK Stockholm.
   

  

 On a day-to-day basis at Maje, you will welcome our customers, offer them a personalised and emotional experience, develop customer loyalty, improve the client portfolio of the store, handle transactions and stock, implement visual merchandising guidelines, ….
   

  

**Working for Maje is:**
* Starting your adventure with a personalised onboarding on your first week;
* Contributing to the further development of our brand with a unique and courteous service;
* Working alongside passionate, caring and dynamic teams;
* Participating to ambitious projects in a brand turned towards future, innovation and durability;
* Having opportunities for a career development within the Maje or the SMCP Group.


**The benefits Maje has to offer are:**
* A monthly bonus scheme
* Discounts on your purchases in the SMCP brands
* A travel allowance
* An illimited access to our E-learning Platform: Mylearning


**Recruitment process:**
* You will be contacted over the phone for a first exchange with the store manager;
* If this first call confirms our ambitions are matching, you will be invited for a face-to-face interview in store with the manager.


**Qualifications**
 You have a taste for challenges and are animated by the fashion world?
   

  

 You are motivated, bold, entrepreneur at heart?
   

  

 Are you inspired by the following values: kindness, liberty, creativity, generosity and family?
   

  

**Do not wait any longer, join Maje.**

title: Onsite IT Support Technician (Field-Based – Sweden & Nordic Travel)
description:
📍
 *Location: Stockholm (field-based with travel across the Nordics)* 




 🗓
 *Start date: Training hours in June, official start on July 1st* 




  





**We’re hiring!** 




 Are you passionate about IT and eager to grow your skills in a hands-on, customer-facing role? We’re looking for a motivated
 **IT Support Technician** 
 with at least one year of experience to join our team. This is a dynamic role that combines technical support with excellent customer service — perfect for someone who enjoys working on-site and solving real-world tech problems.
 



  





 🌟 What You’ll Do
 



 In this role, you’ll be responsible for visiting client locations to deliver on-site IT support. Your tasks will vary from basic to advanced, depending on your experience level — and we’ll provide training as needed.
 



 Your responsibilities will include:
 


* Installing and configuring hardware and software
* Troubleshooting technical issues and ensuring systems run smoothly
* Setting up networking equipment such as routers and switches
* Supporting customer sites with excellent communication and professionalism
* Traveling within Sweden and at least 50 days annually across the Nordic countries



  





 🧩 What We’re Looking For
 



**Required Qualifications:** 



* At least 1 year of IT support experience
* Fluency in Swedish and English (C1 level or higher in both)
* A valid driver’s license (own car is a plus)
* Willingness to travel regularly, both by car and public transportation
* A blend of technical knowledge and soft skills – you're both a problem solver and a people person



**Soft Skills That Matter:** 



* Strong communication, both verbal and written
* Attention to detail and ability to follow procedures precisely
* Proactive attitude and ability to prioritize tasks independently
* Willingness to take initiative and learn on the job



  





 🎯 Bonus Points (Nice to Have)
 


* Experience working with networking hardware, cabling, or electrical setup
* CompTIA A+ or Cisco certifications
* Experience installing hardware, including POS systems
* Skills in mounting Access Points or similar equipment



  





 💡 Why Join Us?
 



 We value curiosity, motivation, and a desire to grow. If you’re passionate about IT, eager to learn new technologies, and enjoy working in a dynamic and supportive environment, you’ll fit right in. We’re not just looking for a technician — we’re looking for a future expert.
 



  





**Ready to apply?** 




 Send us your CV and a short note telling us why you’d be a great fit. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Junior Designer to H&M Kids Baby Accessories
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 Do you have a great passion for the Kids Baby customer? Are you excited to join us on our ambitious journey creating the best accessories for this important young customer? Our customers love our fashionable, cute, playful, and creative products and we look for you with the passion and ability to take the collections to the next level. Come work in our supportive, positive and creative team where the sky is the limit!
   

  

 As a Junior Designer, you support a Product Designer in designing and developing the accessories collections, including swimwear, dress-up items, winter hats, scarves and gloves, caps, bucket hats, toys, and products for our dedicated Baby customers. The role involves, but is not limited to, flat sketching, work in CLO 3D, assist with fittings, produce and update collection overviews and colours collaborating with print design. This is a great opportunity to develop from your current individual design level, whilst learning from our global team.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* BA/MA degree in Fashion Design working as a Junior Designer today
* A passion for and understanding of our H&M Baby customer and trends
* Strong customer focus and commercial thinking
* High work pace in Illustrator & Photoshop
* CLO 3D work experience
* PLM work experience is meriting
* Print design skills are meriting
* English fluency (Swedish not necessary)


 And people who are…
   

  

* You are genuinely fashion trend driven, always staying ahead of the curve
* Driven team player who can work at high tempo and thrives in a constantly changing work environment


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 If this sounds interesting and you fit the qualifications, apply here by
 **13th of June with CV and design portfolio** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading). All documents should be in English.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Perception Software Engineer
description:
**Company**
 Qualcomm Auto Ltd Sweden Filial
   

  

**Job Area**
 Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering
   

  

**General Summary**
 Are you passionate about advancing
 **ADAS** 
 and
 **Autonomous Driving** 
 systems? Imagine contributing to a safer world while collaborating with brilliant, creative, and enjoyable colleagues. Dive into exciting and challenging technology—apply today for this rewarding opportunity!
   

  

**We are Perception within Qualcomm Automotive**
 Qualcomm is an American multinational corporation known for our creation of semiconductors, software, and services related to wireless technology.
   

  

 Our Perception organization belong to the Automotive branch delivering the Snapdragon Digital Chassis - a set of cloud-connected platforms for telematics and connectivity, digital cockpit, and driver assistance and autonomy.
   

  

 As a Perception Software Engineer at Qualcomm Automotive, you will design, develop, create, modify and validate state-of-the-art computer vision software for autonomous driving and advanced driver assistance systems. You will be part of Requirement Area Spatial Awareness, working closely with experts in different areas within computer vision. You will have the opportunity to contribute with your expertise as well as learn from other highly skilled developers. Together you develop algorithms for Detection of Freespace, i.e. Drivable area for the vehicle, enabling autonomous braking, adaptive cruise control and high-level autonomy.
   

  

 As a member of one of our cross functional teams, you will be performing tasks covering all parts of the product development cycle, including software design, machine learning, hands on work with data, testing, writing requirements and functional safety.
   

  

**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.


 OR
   

  

 Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
   

  

 OR
   

  

 PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
   

  

* 2+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.


 As a person, we are looking for you who have a drive and “can do”-attitude, as well as the willingness to learn and expand your skillset in new areas. We also believe you are highly motivated and a pragmatic problem solver. Preferably, you also have previous experience from leadership positions as Team Lead or Tech Lead.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who matches at least 2-3 of the descriptions below:
   

  

* Software Development: You have a robust software development background, preferably complemented by expertise in system design and architecture (required).
* Language and Tools: Proficiency in languages and tools for machine learning and SW development, particularly and C/C++, python and tensorflow.
* Machine Learning: You bring practical experience in machine learning development, gained from relevant industry contexts. This includes practical experience of working with and developing the datasets used.
* Computer Vision: You have experience from applying algorithms to solve complex problems within Computer Vision.


**Preferred Qualification**
* Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering Physics, Machine Learning, Computer Science or related field.
* 8+ years of Software Engineering, Computer Vision, Machine learning and/or related work experience.
* 1+ years in leadership position (Team Lead, Tech Lead, Project Lead or similar)
* References to a particular number of years experience are for indicative purposes only. Applications from candidates with equivalent experience will be considered, provided that the candidate can demonstrate an ability to fulfill the principal duties of the role and possesses the required competencies.


 Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, rest assured that Qualcomm is committed to providing an accessible process. You may e-mail disability-accomodations@qualcomm.com or call Qualcomm's toll-free number found here. Upon request, Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations to support individuals with disabilities to be able participate in the hiring process. Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. (Keep in mind that this email address is used to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).
   

  

 Qualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.
   

  

**To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies** 
 : Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.
   

  

 If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.
   

  

**3070687**

title: Energy Data Scientist
company_industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution
description:
Do you want to be part of facilitating the green transition? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your actions drive meaningful change? Do you enjoy solving hard problems together with ambitious people? If this sounds like you, this could be a perfect match.
   

  

**Join us to facilitate the green transition**
 Electrification and the transition to fossil-free energy create fantastic opportunities for us as individuals, as a company, and for society at large. However, it also creates challenges, especially for our energy system. Ingrid Capacity is a new kind of energy company on a mission to shape the future of energy. We challenge conventional energy models with intelligent energy services for grid operators and users. By uniquely combining software, hardware, and commercial innovation, we tackle one of the biggest bottlenecks to the energy transition: electricity grid constraints. This enables us to accelerate electrification and contribute to a more resilient, competitive, and sustainable energy system. Our impact is here and now. Since our founding in 2022, we have built a leading electricity trading and optimization platform, commissioned and now operate over 200 MWh of large-scale energy storage facilities, and have an additional 340 MWh under construction across Europe. Today, Ingrid Capacity is in a rapid growth phase.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Software and smart solutions is a cornerstone of solving the bottlenecks in the power system and Ingrid Capacity’s company strategy. Our Ingrid Technology teams builds and maintains software for grid analyses and simulations, power trading and optimization algorithms to maximize efficiency within the grid. We also focus on creating a data-driven culture by building data pipelines and a Business Intelligence layer to provide stakeholders with actionable insights. Our team plays a key role in driving strategic decision-making and overall company success, and we work closely together to ensure a smooth transition of ideas from concept to reality. At Ingrid Tech, we foster a collaborative and inclusive environment where everyone’s voice is valued. We believe in empowering our team members to make a real impact and being part of shaping the energy system of the future.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will work analyzing and building models for our software product suite aimed at alleviating congestions in the power system. You’ll be leveraging your expertise within in the energy sector, using Python, data analysis and mathematical/statistical modelling to collaborate across different teams. You'll inform strategic decisions related to energy storage optimization, grid analysis, and more. Your conscientious approach to data preparation and cleaning will ensure the accuracy and completeness of your work, forming the foundation for sound decision-making.
   

  

 We are looking for a proactive and technically skilled Data scientist to join our team and help drive our mission of transforming the energy sector.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Analyze and model developments in the power grid and data from our assets to support the organization and build new products for our customers.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights for strategic energy storage and grid analysis projects.
* Design, build and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize energy trends, grid performance, and storage optimization.
* Stay updated on energy market trends and integrate best practices into workflows.
* Promote data integrity and literacy across the organization and support a data-driven culture.


**Key Qualifications**
* Background in energy systems, in particular transmission and distribution either through a degree in energy systems engineering, statistics or a related field and/or practical experience in the energy sector.
* 2-5 years of experience working with Python in a production environment.
* Solid knowledge of SQL and experience working with structured and unstructured data.
* Working knowledge of forecasting (statistical and/or machine learning based) and optimization methods (linear programming and similar).
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Superset, Looker, PowerBI)
* Ability to balance technical depth with business impact, continuously aligning data science work with organizational goals.
* Experience with DBT, GCP (especially BigQuery), and Airflow is a plus, but not required.
* Experience with ML Ops tools and data science infrastructure (e.g., model deployment, monitoring, pipelines) is a plus, but not required.


**What We Offer**
 At Ingrid Capacity, we are not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We are at the forefront of the global energy transition, dedicated to shaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation, where we dare to push boundaries and turn bold ideas into reality.
   

  

 We firmly believe that the foundation of any successful company lies in its culture. At Ingrid Capacity, we understand that building a thriving organization demands more than just technology and innovation; it requires a company culture firmly rooted in trust, growth, and the ability to learn from mistakes. We believe that skills can be nurtured in a variety of contexts, starting from within oneself and growing together with people we trust. We are also serious about the wellbeing of our colleagues and having fun together, and with regularly hosted social activities and group training classes, we create a workplace where we can truly thrive.
   

  

**Application**
 Sounds like a match? Don’t be a stranger and welcome to apply! We’ll make selections on an ongoing basis and finalize the recruitment as soon as we’ve found the perfect match.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 /Team Ingrid Capacity

title: Sales Associate
description:
